snippet: South Sudan is only a few months old, and two members of its upstart press corps have already been briefly jailed.
abstract: South Sudan is only a few months old, and two members of its upstart press corps have already been briefly jailed; daily newspaper The Citizen faces challenge from a new military leadership which is not always hospitable to a free press, a freedom guaranteed in country's new constitution.
lead_paragraph: South Sudan is only a few months old, and two members of its upstart press corps have already been briefly jailed.

headline.seo: In South Sudan, a Rough Start to Press Freedom
headline.main: In a Fledgling Country, Perils for the Press
headline.print_headline: In a Fledgling Country, Perils for the Press
